poem:
### Bourbon Street Lament

On Bourbon Street, where music spills  
into a river of revelry,  
the careless night drew shadows out,  
leaving hope flattened under wheels.  
Brandon, lifted by laughter, faltered—  
now his absence haunts the saxophone's wail.  
Heather counts the stars in anger,  
as the city wrestles with its silence,  
wondering who will carry consequence.
